article_text:
SHANGHAI—A government-backed industry association lowered its projection for China's automobile sales this year as a slowing economy, coupled with China's antipollution efforts, hit demand for commercial vehicles.

China's auto sales will likely reach 23.8 million vehicles this year, up 8.3% from a year earlier, the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers said in a statement on Monday. That is compared with an increase of 8% to...
